founding_conditions.capital: Access to up to $15M via venture/angel capital if the opportunity is clean. $8-10M readily accessible; up to $15M for compelling physical/production plays. VC/angel appetite confirmed shifting toward hard-tech/robotics/physical-economy (a16z American Dynamism, BlackRock overweight industrials, JPM supercycle broadening, Goldman $500B+ AI capex).
founding_conditions.team: 2 founders -- ML/AI Masters (Georgia Tech) + operator (Argentina native, US resident)
founding_conditions.location: Davis CA -- 1hr from SF, direct access to UC Davis ag robotics ecosystem, Central Valley specialty crop growers, CA food production cluster
founding_conditions.markets: US + LATAM lowest friction, any geography viable on economics

current.name: 5-Axis Structural Durability Scoring (Cycle 6+, stress-tested Cycle 7)

economic_force_magnitude.description: TAM x cost advantage ratio x Jevons expansion potential

structural_compounding.description: Does business get HARDER to compete with over time?

convergence_resistance.description: What prevents competitors from replicating in 3 years?

capital_efficiency.description: Structural advantage gained per dollar invested

current.stress_test_validation: Cycle 7 tested 3 alternative weight vectors (force-dominant, compounding-dominant, convergence-dominant). 7 of top 10 models robust across ALL vectors. Architecture dominance partially weight-dependent: physical dominates convergence/compounding, data compounding dominates force.

history.weights: balanced 1.0 across: competitive_density, unit_economics_clarity, distribution_specificity, moat_durability, customer_findability
history.reason: v2 cycles 0-4 used balanced weights on sector-level scoring.

history.weights: balanced 1.0 across: competitive_density, unit_economics_clarity, distribution_specificity, moat_durability, customer_findability
history.reason: YC-granularity decomposition. Customer-segment-based scoring. PROBLEM: scored tactical accessibility, not structural durability.

history.weights: weighted: economic_force (35%), structural_compounding (25%), convergence_resistance (20%), timing_structural_fit (10%), capital_efficiency (10%)
history.reason: Architecture-based decomposition. CORRECTS Cycle 5: scores STRUCTURAL DURABILITY. Physical architectures dominate because convergence resistance from physical assets >> software.

history.weights: Same as cycle 6 (validated by stress test)
history.reason: NAICS-systematic expansion + stress test. 3 alternative weight vectors tested. Core weights VALIDATED: 7 of top 10 robust across all vectors. Key finding: physical vs digital dominance is partially weight-dependent, not absolute.

acquire_and_modernize.description: Buy existing business at demographic-distress pricing, deploy AI+robotics. Highest convergence resistance. C7 NAICS expansion adds: printing, plastics, furniture, metal fab, auto parts, dairy, confectionery, foundry, rubber, glass, paper, sawmill.

rollup_consolidation.description: Acquire-and-modernize at scale. Strongest compounding mechanism. C7 adds: printing, plastics, furniture, metal fab, electrical, dental, bakery, coating, auto parts, beverage rollups.

data_compounding.description: Service entry + data flywheel. Weak at year 1, unassailable at year 5. C7 adds: trades intelligence, insurance claims, workforce, construction, legal, staffing, veterinary.

full_service_replacement.description: Replace entire function (not just sell a tool). Christensen disruptive layer. C7 adds: allied health, staffing, home health, lending, child care, design, consulting, banking, nursing, accounting verticals.

regulatory_moat_builder.description: Build compliance infrastructure. Every new regulation increases value. C7 adds: veterinary, dental, child care, construction, financial AI compliance.

platform_infrastructure.description: Build once, sell many. Moderate convergence resistance. C7 adds: trades, home health, elder care, real estate, manufacturing, compliance, nursing, lending, dental, agriculture.

marketplace_network.description: Network effects once at critical mass. Binary value. C7 adds: trades contractor, elder care, micro-firm, print capacity, food producer, manufacturing capacity, healthcare services.

arbitrage_window.description: Time-limited structural mispricing. Act during PE distress window. C7 adds: veterinary, staffing, dental arbitrage acquisitions.

physical_production_ai.description: Greenfield AI-native production. Lower than acquire-and-modernize (no inherited moats). C7 adds: HVAC/cooling for data centers, medical device contract mfg, cosmetics contract mfg, auto parts, craft beverage, print-on-demand, ag equipment.

vertical_saas.description: LOWEST score. Easy to start but hard to defend. Platform incumbents can add features. C7 confirms: vertical SaaS consistently scores lowest across all weight vectors.

top_20_models.name: Full-Service AI Finance Function for SMBs
AI Operations Platform for Building Equipment Contractors
Insurance AI Compliance + Bias Auditing Platform
Acquire + Modernize Plastics Injection Molding Shop
Full-Service AI Practice Operations for Allied Health

running_patterns.description: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure Convergence: Healthcare, legal, accounting, insurance all releasing stored above-CPI energy simultaneously
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: NAICS data quantifies depth: $207B automatable wages across 7 key occupations. Baumol force produces models across 8 of 10 architecture types. NAICS 5613 (staffing) declining 7.6% = ACTIVE cascade. NAICS 5223 (credit intermediation support) declining 10.7% with wages up 13.8% = textbook Schumpeterian gap.

NAICS systematic scan reveals 12+ manufacturing sectors with retiring owners beyond CNC and food: printing (28K estabs), plastics (12K), furniture (12.7K), metal fab, coating, foundry, rubber, glass, paper, sawmill. Acquire-and-modernize architecture extends across all these sectors.

NAICS reveals new regulatory moat opportunities: veterinary (state corporate practice laws), child care (50-state licensing), construction permitting (jurisdictional fragmentation), dental (FTC scrutiny of PE), financial AI (multi-regulator compliance). 5 new regulatory moat builder models added.

Confirmed across NAICS data. Building trades (NAICS 2382): 499K new workers needed = massive unmet demand. Allied health (NAICS 6213): employment growing 6.8%, most fragmented healthcare sector (191K establishments). Jevons expansion applies to services AND to physical production (lower cost = more accessible custom manufacturing).

running_patterns.description: Robotics x AI Compound Production Cost Compression
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: NAICS-driven expansion adds 12+ new manufacturing sectors for cobot deployment: printing (28K estabs, 85% say AI critical), plastics injection molding (robotic part removal proven), furniture (AI design-to-CNC), metal fabrication, auto parts, foundry, coating/heat treating. $2.26B Q1 2026 robotics funding validates continued investment appetite.
Stress test validates: full-service replacement (78 avg) consistently outscores vertical SaaS (62 avg) across ALL weight vectors. The 16-point gap is structural and weight-independent.

running_patterns.description: Dead Business Revival at AI-Native Cost Structure
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: Pattern extended beyond accounting: PE-distressed veterinary, dental, and staffing practices now available for AI-native revival. Combined validated market failures >$1B. NAICS 5613 staffing employment declining 7.6% = active Schumpeterian destruction creating revival opportunities.

STRESS TEST NUANCE: Physical dominance is PARTIALLY weight-dependent. Physical architectures dominate under convergence-dominant (86.4 avg) and compounding-dominant (86.1 avg) weights. But data compounding (digital) takes #1 position under force-dominant weights (88.1 avg). CONCLUSION: physical is MORE DURABLE, digital captures MORE ECONOMIC FORCE. Strategy implication UNCHANGED: start physical for durability, build digital for scale.

running_patterns.description: Data Compounding as Bridge to Unassailability
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: UPGRADED from strong. Stress test confirms: data compounding models score #1 under force-dominant weights. C7-DC-FIN-01 (87) and C7-DC-HC-01 (85) remain top 10 across ALL weight vectors. New data compounding models added: trades intelligence, insurance claims, workforce, construction, legal, veterinary.

running_patterns.description: Timing for Physical, Compounding for Digital
running_patterns.cycle_7_update: UPGRADED from strong. NAICS data deepens: printing, plastics, furniture, metal fab ALL have retiring owners (timing windows). Data compounding models ALL have multi-year flywheel designs. The dual strategy is validated across 12+ manufacturing sectors and 7+ data compounding plays.

running_patterns.detail: Systematic NAICS QCEW screening (293 4-digit industries, 933 6-digit sub-industries) reveals sectors invisible to top-down analysis. PRINTING (NAICS 3231): 28K establishments = highest manufacturing fragmentation, totally unexplored before C7. BUILDING EQUIPMENT CONTRACTORS (NAICS 2382): 2.46M employees, 70% can't find workers = massive Baumol/Jevons opportunity. EMPLOYMENT SERVICES (NAICS 5613): 3.57M employees declining 7.6% = active cascade. ALLIED HEALTH (NAICS 6213): 191K establishments = most fragmented healthcare. Bottom-up NAICS scanning produces higher-quality discoveries than top-down theme scanning.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Stress Test Reveals Weight-Conditional Architecture Rankings
running_patterns.detail: The physical > digital architecture dominance from Cycle 6 is PARTIALLY weight-dependent. Under convergence-dominant weights, physical (86.4) dominates. Under force-dominant weights, data compounding (88.1) dominates. 7 of top 10 models are ROBUST across all 3 alternative vectors: C6-RC-MFG-01, C6-AM-MFG-01, C6-DC-FIN-01, C6-RMB-HC-01, C6-AM-FOOD-01, C6-DC-HC-01, C6-FSR-HC-01. Weight-SENSITIVE models: C6-FSR-FIN-01 (force-dependent), C6-RC-FOOD-01 (compounding-dependent), C6-AW-ACC-01 (timing-dependent).

running_patterns.description: NEW: PE Distress Cascade Extending to New Sectors
running_patterns.detail: PE rollup distress now visible beyond accounting: veterinary (saturation + FTC scrutiny + regulatory backlash), dental (137 PE acquisitions in 2024 but rising valuations squeezing returns), staffing (employment declining 7.6%), printing (secular digital decline stressing PE print companies). Counter-PE strategy (acquire at 3-5x EBITDA vs PE-paid 8-12x, operate with AI cost structure PE can't match) applies across multiple sectors.

opportunity_landscape.summary: Cycle 7 expanded from 187 to 387 models via NAICS-systematic screening (293 4-digit industries), stress-tested scoring robustness with 3 alternative weight vectors, and mapped all 80 cells of the 8x10 force-architecture matrix. KEY FINDINGS: (1) Stress test validates scoring: 7 of top 10 robust across all weight vectors. Physical dominance is partially weight-conditional -- physical more DURABLE, digital data compounding more FORCE. (2) NAICS screening discovers 8 new high-value sectors invisible to top-down analysis: printing 28K estabs, building trades 2.46M workers, staffing -7.6% decline, allied health 191K estabs, plastics 12K estabs, furniture 12.7K estabs, credit intermediation gap, elder care 981K estabs. (3) Force-architecture matrix shows 16 structurally impossible cells, 12 previously unexplored but promising cells (all now filled). Baumol cure and Silver Tsunami are the most architecturally versatile forces (8 of 10 types each).

key_unknowns: Customer discovery interviews -- STILL TOP PRIORITY. No actual conversations in any cycle. Talk to: (a) retiring CNC/printing/food production owners, (b) SMB owners doing own bookkeeping, (c) independent healthcare practices about prior auth pain, (d) HVAC/plumbing contractors about workforce challenges, (e) allied health practitioners about billing pain.
SBA 504 CDC relationship establishment -- TIME SENSITIVE before Sept 2026 deadline.
BizBuySell specific acquisition targets -- narrow to 5-10 CNC shops, 5-10 food producers, 5-10 print shops with criteria.
Cobot integration partner in CA -- Standard Bots vs UR vs FANUC for specific shop configurations.
Data compounding feasibility -- can aggregated SMB financial data be productized while maintaining privacy?
Regulatory moat builder competitive landscape -- any funded players specifically building multi-state healthcare/insurance/veterinary AI compliance?
PE distress timeline -- when do first forced sales from $1.2T maturity wall appear in accounting, dental, veterinary, staffing?
Printing industry acquisition targets -- what % of 28K print shops are viable acquisition candidates (growing segments vs declining)?
Building trades AI adoption rate -- what % of 230K building equipment contractor establishments have adopted any AI/scheduling tools?
Allied health practice billing costs -- quantify the per-practice cost of billing/admin as % of revenue for PT, chiro, optometry, speech.
Plastics injection molding cobot readiness -- which specific robotic cells are proven for injection molding shops?
Dental PE distress timing -- when do FTC actions and rising valuations force PE dental exits?
next_cycle_suggestions: PRIORITY 1: Customer discovery interviews -- 10+ conversations across top 5 opportunities (CNC shop owners, food producers, SMB bookkeeping, healthcare practices, building contractors).
PRIORITY 2: SBA 504 CDC relationship -- contact Statewide CDC, model capital stacks for printing and plastics acquisitions (in addition to CNC and food).
PRIORITY 3: Narrow BizBuySell acquisition targets to 5-10 per sector: CNC, food, printing, plastics, furniture.

PRIORITY 4: Deep-dive on NAICS-discovered sectors: commercial printing (28K estabs -- what segments are growing?), building trades (2.46M workers -- AI adoption landscape?), allied health (191K estabs -- billing pain quantification?).
PRIORITY 5: Stress test NEW cycle 7 top 10 models with real competitive intelligence (web search for competitors per model).
PRIORITY 6: Architecture sequencing plan: map optimal order of physical acquisitions + parallel digital data compounding builds.
PRIORITY 7: Build prototype specification for #1 or #2 opportunity (CNC rollup or financial intelligence platform).
